item.title: Nexus Revival - Yu-Gi-Oh World Championship 2011 Homebrew (NDS)
item.content:
Yu-Gi-Oh! World Championship 2011 - Nexus Revival Patch

Nexus Revival 2011 is a ROM homebrew for Yu-Gi-Oh! World Championship 2011 that revitalizes the game with new content, enhanced graphics, and improved gameplay mechanics. This patch allows you to enjoy a fresh experience while preserving the original charm of the game.

Features

  • New Card Packs ‚Äì Access additional cards not originally available in the base game.
  • Custom Graphics ‚Äì Enhanced visuals for a modernized look.
  • New CPU Decks ‚Äì Face more challenging and diverse AI opponents.
  • Gameplay Enhancements ‚Äì Minor tweaks to improve balance and replayability.
  • Educational Value ‚Äì A great resource for ROM homebrew enthusiasts to explore game modification techniques.

Credits

  • tereotis ‚Äì Hex offsets and patch groundwork
  • volo ‚Äì Python modifications, card-to-pack mapping, CPU deck creation
  • opiter09 ‚Äì PAC file unpacking
  • jovel, g30rgi, dongtae26 & others ‚Äì Deck contributions and testing

Special thanks to the ROM homebrew community for inspiration and guidance.

Enjoy dueling with Nexus Revival 2011! üÉè

item.title: 4-Division Toolset
item.content:
4-Division Toolset

Welcome to the 4-Division Toolset, a collection of web-based utilities designed to streamline creative and web development tasks. This toolset is hosted online and offers easy access to various tools directly from your browser.

Tools Overview

1. FBXu - Online Model Viewer

An interactive 3D model viewer that allows you to preview and inspect 3D models online. Perfect for designers and developers working with 3D assets.

2. 3D Text Generator

A tool to create customized 3D text for web or graphic design projects. Supports font customization and text styling for quick design iterations.

3. Bootstrap 5 Color Theme Generator

Easily generate Bootstrap 5 color themes for your websites. Customize colors and preview your theme before implementation.

Access the Tools

You can explore the tools directly via the following links:

  • FBXu - Online Model Viewer
  • 3D Text Generator
  • Bootstrap 5 Color Theme Generator

Full Tool List

For a complete list of available tools, check out List of Tools.

item.title: BalanceSigns 1.8.8 Minecraft Server Plugin
item.content:
BalanceSigns

Economy Bukkit plugin for Minecraft 1.8.8

Overview

Compiled for Minecraft version 1.8.8

Requires Vault for economy rewards (Tested with Vault 1.5.5)

Put [topbalance] on a sign to get started

Wait for server refresh

Right click on sign opens GUI with top players

Features

  • Returns top players from server with highest amount of ecoconmic worth.
  • GUI Based
  • Adjustable config to change paramenters of how the plugin works
  • No permissions

Permissions

balancesigns.createsign

Modrinth

item.title: Slayertasks 1.8.8 Minecraft Server Plugin
item.content:
Slayertasks

Slayer task bukkit plugin for Minecraft 1.8.8

Overview

Assignable mob quests/tasks and bounties ! Simple lightweight quest system with config and permissions

Compiled for Minecraft version 1.8.8

Requires Vault for economy rewards (Tested with Vault 1.5.5)

Assign tasks to players to fight different mobs specified in the config !

Features:

Simple and lightweight quest system without saving information. GUI based for ease of accessibility Different scales of difficulty with different amount of mobs and economy rewards (fully customizable) Full integration of Vault API Permissions

Commands:

/slayer - Opens slayer menu

/skc - Checks task progress

Permissions:

slayertasks.slayer

slayertasks.skc

Source Modrinth

item.title: Retro Revisions 1.2.5 Minecraft Mod
item.content:
RetroRevisions

Minecraft 1.2.5 mod for backporting various features from future versions of Minecraft.

Features

  • Block of Netherite (Made with 9 diamond blocks)
  • Beacon (Complete backport of the beacon that extends in a 50 block radius) (Made by smelting Lux Aeterna)
  • Item frames
  • Daylight / Night Detectors (Made with glowstone in middle, surrounded by redstone)

Original Blocks:

  • Chimney (redstone surrounded by coal) block that emits smoke when powered by redstone
  • Lux Aeterna (Made with 9 Blocks of Netherite)
  • Iron Boat (Unbreakable collision boat that can move fast on ice like in later versions)
  • Redstone Stairs (Changes direction based on redstone signal) (three redstone dust on bottom, 3 iron ingots like stairs)

Installation:

  add to the minecraft.jar the entire zip in versions either through prism/mmc or manually

Source Modrinth

item.title: Trap Runner (GBA) Homebrew
item.content:
Trap Runner (GBA)

Year: 2022
Engine: BP Core Engine
Platform: Game Boy Advance

Overview

Trap Runner is a Game Boy Advance game created using the BP Core Engine. It was one of my first coding projects, developed in 2022. The gameplay is simple, yet addictive, inspired by classic games like Copter.

In Trap Runner, you control a character that continuously moves forward. Your goal is to navigate up and down to avoid enemies and walls while trying to survive as long as possible. The game features a timer that measures how far you can go. If you crash into an obstacle or enemy, the timer resets, challenging you to beat your previous record.

Gameplay

  • Controls: Move up and down to avoid obstacles.
  • Objective: Survive for as long as possible without crashing.
  • Mechanics:
    • Timer tracks your progress.
    • Collision with enemies or walls resets the timer.
    • Continuous challenge inspired by classic side-scrolling avoidance games.

The fast-paced gameplay encourages quick reflexes and precise movements, making each attempt exciting.

Development Process

Creating Trap Runner was an early project that taught me a lot about game development for the GBA. Here’s a summary of the process:

  1. Choosing the Engine:
    I selected the BP Core Engine for its simplicity and GBA compatibility, which allowed me to focus on gameplay mechanics rather than low-level hardware concerns.

  2. Designing the Gameplay:
    Inspired by Copter, I wanted a simple, yet addictive gameplay loop: move, avoid, survive, and repeat. I implemented a timer system to track progress and reset upon crashes.

  3. Implementing Obstacles and Enemies:
    I coded enemy patterns and wall collisions to provide increasing challenges as the player progresses.

  4. Polishing and Testing:
    I spent time balancing the game’s difficulty, adjusting the speed and spacing of obstacles to make it fair but challenging.

  5. Final Touches:
    I added a basic UI to display the timer and reset the game upon crashing, creating a complete experience ready to play on the GBA or an emulator.

Play the Game

You can try Trap Runner in your browser using an emulator:

‚ñ∂ Play Trap Runner

Trap Runner remains a personal milestone in my early coding journey, blending nostalgia for classic GBA games with the satisfaction of building something from scratch. I also created the OST, which was an awesome experience for me.

item.title: Ironplanner.men
item.content:
ironplanner.men - Group Ironman Planner For Oldschool Runescape

https://ironplanner.men is a web-based planning and management tool designed specifically for Old School RuneScape (OSRS) Group Ironman teams. It enables groups to efficiently coordinate tasks, track progress, and achieve goals together.

Key Features

  • Member Management
    Add and manage group members, assign roles, and track responsibilities. Each member can be color-coded for quick identification.

  • Task Management (Kanban Board)
    Create, edit, and organize tasks using a dynamic Kanban-style board. Tasks can be filtered by member or type, prioritized, and moved between columns (Backlog, In Progress, Done) via drag-and-drop.

  • Goals Tracking
    Set group goals with specific targets and deadlines. Goals include optional notes or strategies to guide members toward completion.

  • Wishlist / Item Tracking
    Maintain a shared list of items your group wants to acquire, track quantities, and mark items as acquired.

  • Notes & Strategies
    Store strategies, progress notes, and meeting notes in a centralized location. Notes are saved locally and included when sharing or exporting the planner.

  • Interactive Timeline
    Visualize tasks with due dates on an interactive timeline. Features zoom controls, today marker, and horizontal scrolling for easy navigation.

  • Progress Visualization
    View overall group progress with a doughnut chart showing tasks in Backlog, In Progress, and Done.

  • Share & Export
    Generate shareable links to share the current state of the planner or export/import the data as JSON for backup and collaboration.

Technology

  • Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Uses Bootstrap 5 for responsive layout and modals
  • SortableJS for drag-and-drop task management
  • Chart.js for progress visualization
  • Fully client-side with local storage, no server required

ironplanner.men streamlines group coordination for OSRS Group Ironman players, helping teams stay organized, track tasks, achieve goals, and maximize efficiency in-game.
